com.scalar.db.sql

Interface SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransactionManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, SqlStatementExecutable

    public interface SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransactionManager
extends SqlStatementExecutable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A transaction manager abstraction for two-phase commit transactions for ScalarDB SQL API. You can execute a one-shot query (DDL and DML) with the execute() methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Begins a transaction.

      Closes this transaction manager.

      Returns a Metadata object.
      SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction join(java.lang.String transactionId)

      SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction resume(java.lang.String transactionId)

      • Methods inherited from interface com.scalar.db.sql.SqlStatementExecutable

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction begin()
        Begins a transaction.
        Returns:
        an instance of SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction for the begun transaction
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to begin due to retryable faults. You can retry the transaction.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to begin due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • begin

        SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction begin(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Begins a transaction with the specified transaction ID. It is users' responsibility to guarantee uniqueness of the ID, so it is not recommended to use this method unless you know exactly what you are doing.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - a user-provided unique transaction ID
        Returns:
        an instance of SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction for the begun transaction
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to begin due to retryable faults. You can retry the transaction.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to begin due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction, but you may not be able to begin the transaction due to nontransient faults

      • join

        SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction join(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Joins the specified transaction.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - a transaction ID associated with the transaction to join
        Returns:
        an instance of SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction for the joined transaction
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to join due to retryable faults. You can retry the transaction from the beginning.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to join due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction from the beginning, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • resume

        SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction resume(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Resumes an ongoing transaction associated with the specified transaction ID.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - a transaction ID associated with the transaction to resume
        Returns:
        an instance of SqlTwoPhaseCommitTransaction for the resumed transaction
        Throws:
        TransactionRetryableException - if the transaction fails to resume due to retryable faults (e.g., the transaction not found). You can retry the transaction from the beginning.
        SqlException - if the transaction fails to resume due to transient or nontransient faults. You can try retrying the transaction from the beginning, but the transaction may still fail if the cause is nontranient

      • getMetadata

        Metadata getMetadata()
        Returns a Metadata object.
        Returns:
        a Metadata object.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this transaction manager.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
